[[Mc 4,21]]Jesus said to his disciples, â€œIs a lamp brought in to be placed under a bushel basket or under a bed, and not to be placed on a lampstand?
[[Mc 4,22]]For there is nothing hidden except to be made visible; nothing is secret except to come to light.
[[Mc 4,23]]Anyone who has ears to hear ought to hear."
[[Mc 4,24]]He also told them, "Take care what you hear. The measure with which you measure will be measured out to you, and still more will be given to you.
[[Mc 4,25]]To the one who has, more will be given; from the one who has not, even what he has will be taken away."

first_reading.title: Letter to the Hebrews
first_reading.text:
[[He 10,19]]Brothers and sisters, since through the blood of Jesus we have confidence of entrance into the sanctuary
[[He 10,20]]by the new and living way he opened for us through the veil, that is, his flesh,
[[He 10,21]]and since we have "a great priest over the house of God,"
[[He 10,22]]let us approach with a sincere heart and in absolute trust, with our hearts sprinkled clean from an evil conscience and our bodies washed in pure water.
[[He 10,23]]Let us hold unwaveringly to our confession that gives us hope, for he who made the promise is trustworthy.
[[He 10,24]]We must consider how to rouse one another to love and good works.
[[He 10,25]]We should not stay away from our assembly, as is the custom of some, but encourage one another, and this all the more as you see the day drawing near.

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 24,1]]The LORD's are the earth and its fullness; 
the world and those who dwell in it.
[[Ps 24,2]]For he founded it upon the seas 
and established it upon the rivers.

[[Ps 24,3]]Who can ascend the mountain of the LORD? 
or who may stand in his holy place?
[[Ps 24,4a]]One whose hands are sinless, whose heart is clean,
[[Ps 24,4b]]who desires not what is vain.

[[Ps 24,5]]He shall receive a blessing from the LORD, 
a reward from God his savior.
[[Ps 24,6]]Such is the race that seeks for him, 
that seeks the face of the God of Jacob.
